sen.j: 藤原 顕頼（ふじわら の あきより、嘉保元年（1094年） - 久安4年1月5日 (旧暦)（1148年1月27日））は平安時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Akiyori (1094-January 27, 1148) was the Kugyo (court noble), who lived in the end of the Heian Period.
FUJIWARA no Akiyori (1094-January 27, 1148) was a Kugyo (court noble), who lived in the end of the Heian Period.
FUJIWARA no Akiyori (1094 - February 3, 1148) was a Kugyo (court noble), who lived in the end of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。

sen.j: 権中納言・藤原顕隆の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Akitaka, who had the title of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Akitaka, who held the title of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Akitaka, who held the title of Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 母は越後守・藤原季綱の女、悦子（典侍、鳥羽天皇の乳母）。
sen.e: His mother was Etsushi (she had the title of Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) and the menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby) of Emperor Toba), who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Suetsuna, who was the Echigo no kami (Provincial Governor of Echigo).

His mother was Etsushi (she held the title of Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) and the menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby) of Emperor Toba), who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Suetsuna, who was the Echigo no kami (Provincial Governor of Echigo).

His mother was Etsushi (she held the title of Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) and the wet nurse of Emperor Toba), who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Suetsuna, who was the Echigo no kami (Provincial Governor of Echigo).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 子に藤原光頼・藤原惟方・説頼・藤原成頼・祐子（すけこ、平時信の室、平滋子の母）・藤原季成の室（公光の母）・藤原忠隆の室（藤原信頼の母）・藤原師長の室（後に離別）らがいる。
sen.e: His children were FUJIWARA no Mitsuyori, FUJIWARA no Koretaka, Hisayori, FUJIWARA no Nariyori, Sukeko (TAIRA no Tokinobu and the mother of TAIRA no Shigeko), the wife of FUJIWARA no Suenari (The mother of Kinmitsu), and the wife of FUJIWARA no Tadataka (mother of FUJIWARA no Nobuyori, the wife of FUJIWARA no Moronaga (divorced afterwards).

His children were FUJIWARA no Mitsuyori, FUJIWARA no Koretaka, Hisayori, FUJIWARA no Nariyori, Sukeko (TAIRA no Tokinobu and the mother of TAIRA no Shigeko), the wife of FUJIWARA no Suenari (The mother of Kinmitsu), and the wife of FUJIWARA no Tadataka (mother of FUJIWARA no Nobuyori, the wife of FUJIWARA no Moronaga (divorced afterwards).

His children were FUJIWARA no Mitsuyori, FUJIWARA no Korekata, Hisayori, FUJIWARA no Nariyori, Sukeko (a wife of TAIRA no Tokinobu and the mother of TAIRA no Shigeko), the wife of FUJIWARA no Suenari (The mother of Kinmitsu), and the wife of FUJIWARA no Tadataka (mother of FUJIWARA no Nobuyori), the wife of FUJIWARA no Moronaga (divorced afterwards).
sen.cmt: スペルなど修正しました。

sen.j: 天仁元年（1108年）に従五位下に叙せられてから、出雲国・三河国・丹後国・丹波国の受領を歴任する一方、実務官僚としても活躍する。
sen.e: He successively held posts of Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) of the provinces of Izumo, Mikawa, Tango, and Tanba, and was governmental official responsible for practical works after he received the jo rank (court rank) of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1108.

He successively held posts of Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) of the provinces of Izumo, Mikawa, Tango, and Tanba, and was governmental official responsible for practical works after he received the jo rank (court rank) of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1108.

He successively held posts of Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) of Izumo, Mikawa, Tango, and Tanba Provinces, and was governmental official responsible for practical works after he was appointed to the court rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1108.

sen.j: 保安 (元号)3年（1122年）、蔵人・検非違使佐のまま右少弁に任じられて三事兼帯となった。
sen.e: He became Sanjikentai (be assigned with three assignments of Benkan, Kurodo (Chamberlain), and Kebiishi) after he was assigned to be Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right) while staying as the Kurodo (Chamberlain) and Kebiishi no suke (assistant official of the Police and Judicial Chief) in 1122.

He became Sanjikentai (managing three assignments of Benkan, Kurodo (Chamberlain, and Kebiishi) after he was assigned to be Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right) while staying as the Kurodo (Chamberlain) and Kebiishi no suke (assistant official of the Police and Judicial Chief) in 1122.

He became Sanjikentai (managing three assignments of Benkan, Kurodo (Chamberlain), and Kebiishi (a police and judicial chief)) after he was assigned to be Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right) while staying as the Kurodo and Kebiishi no suke (assistant official of the Police and Judicial Chief) in 1122.

sen.j: 天承元年（1131年）に参議、さらに権中納言に昇進して大宰権帥を兼ねる。
sen.e: He became the Sangi (councilor) in 1131 and was promoted to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) and also held the additional post of the Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai fu offices).

He became the Sangi (councilor) in 1131 and was promoted to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) and also held the additional post of the Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai fu offices).
He became the Sangi (councilor) in 1131 and was promoted to Gon Chunagon and also held the additional post of the Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices).
sen.cmt: 前出補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 永治元年（1141年）、権中納言を辞任して民部卿となり、正二位に叙せられた。
sen.e: He quit being the Gon chunagon and became Minbugyo before granted with the jo rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in 1141.
He quit as Gon chunagon and became Minbugyo before being granted with the jo rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in 1141.
He resigned as Gon chunagon and became Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) before being granted with the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in 1141.

sen.j: 鳥羽上皇の腹心として「内外権を執り、際会人に超ゆ」（「本朝新修往生伝」）と評され、議政官を辞してからも重要な議事に参与する。
sen.e: As the trusted man of the retired Emperor Toba, he was praised as "the one who controls the power inside and out, and excels as Saikaijin (際会人) ("Honcho shinshu ojoden") and participated in important political agendas even after retiring from the Giseikan (Legislature).
sen.cmt: 際会人→Saikaijin (際会人)[定訳不明]
sen.e: As the trusted man of retired Emperor Toba, he was praised as "the one who controls the power inside and out, and excels as Saikaijin (際会人) ("Honcho shinshu ojoden") and participated in important political agendas even after retiring from the Giseikan (Legislature).

As the trusted man of retired Emperor Toba, he was praised as 'the one who controls the power inside and out, and is confronted by serious matters more than others' ('Honcho Shinshu Ojo-den' (New collection of hagiographies of those born in the Pure Land)) and participated in important political agendas even after retiring from the Giseikan (Legislature).
sen.cmt: 表現を変え、補足しました。

sen.j: 久安3年（1147年）の、平忠盛・平清盛親子の流罪を要求した延暦寺の強訴においては、延暦寺に同調する藤原頼長の意見を抑えて忠盛・清盛の擁護を進言した。
sen.e: He spoke out for the protection of Tadamori and Kiyomori when Hiei-ji Temple strongly demanded the exile of TAIRA no Tadamori (son) and Kiyomori (father) in 1147 by quelling the opinion of FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who sided with the Hiei-ji.

He spoke out for the protection of Tadamori and Kiyomori when Hiei-ji Temple strongly demanded the exile of TAIRA no Tadamori (son) and Kiyomori (father) in 1147 by quelling the opinion of FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who sided with the Hiei-ji.

He spoke out for the protection of Tadamori and Kiyomori when Enryaku-ji Temple strongly demanded the exile of TAIRA no Tadamori (son) and Kiyomori (father) in 1147 by quelling the opinion of FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who sided with the Enryaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 一方で、後に娘の一人が頼長の子・師長の妻となるなど摂関家との関係も良好であり、院と摂関家の対立を調整する役割も果たした。
sen.e: On the other hand, he had a good relation with the sekkenke (line of regents and advisers) for making one of his daughter to be the wife of the child of Yorinaga, Moronaga and took a balance between the opposition between the in (emperor) and the Sekkenke.

On the other hand, he had good relations with the sekkenke (line of regents and advisers) for having one of his daughters become the wife of the child of Yorinaga, Moronaga and this struck a balance between the opposition between the in (emperor) and the Sekkenke.

On the other hand, he had good relations with the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents) for having one of his daughters become the wife of the child of Yorinaga, Moronaga and this struck a balance between the In (retired emperor) and the Sekkan-ke in conflict.
He passed away at the age of fifty-five in 1148.
He passed away at the age of fifty-five in 1148.
He passed away at the age of 55 in 1148.

sen.j: その後、藤原信西が鳥羽法皇の側近として急速に台頭して摂関家と院近臣の対立も激しくなり、保元の乱につながっていく。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sinzei became the close adviser of Cloistered Emperor Toba and became powerful quickly and the opposition between the sekkenke and the In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier) became severe and led to the Hogen no Ran (Hogen Disturbance).

FUJIWARA no Sinzei became the close adviser of the Cloistered Emperor Toba and quickly became powerful and the opposition between the sekkenke and the In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier) grew severe and led to the Hogen no Ran (Hogen Disturbance).

FUJIWARA no Sinzei became the close adviser of the Cloistered Emperor Toba and quickly became powerful and the opposition between the Sekkan-ke and the In no Kinshin (the retired emperor's courtier) grew severe and led to the Hogen War.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

tit.e: Record of offices held and rank

sen.e: *Dating system used=the old calendar
*Dating system used=the old calendar
Dates and months are in the old calendar.

sen.e: December 2: He retired from Gonchunagon and Dazai gon no sochi positions.

December 2: Retired from Gon Chunagon and Dazai gon no sochi positions.
He was reassigned to the Minbukyo head of the Ministry of Popular affairs) position.
Reassigned to the Minbukyo head of the Ministry of Popular affairs) position.
Reassigned to the position of Minbukyo.
1143: Fifty years old.
1143: Fifty years old.
1143: 50 years old.
January 3: He gained the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
January 3: Gained the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
January 3: Appointed to the rank of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
1148: Fifty-five years old.
1148: Fifty-five years old.
1148: 55 years old.
January 3: He underwent shukke (became a Buddhist priest).

January 3: Became a Buddhist priest.
